intro: Arabis tatarica, commonly known as Tatarian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to eastern Europe and western Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 20–40 cm, featuring basal leaves and showy, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant produces small, round, green capsules that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its early blooming habit and delicate appearance.
